title: Jefferies mandated to review container provider SCF
text:
Alternative asset manager Intermediate Capital Group has tapped US investment bank Jefferies to help prepare its shipping container provider SCF for sale.

It is understood ICG mandated Jefferies for the role in recent days, following a beauty parade that saw a handful of investment banks pitch ICG and SCF's top brass. Banks were notified of the appointment on Monday.

Former Royal Wolf CEO Robert Allan is now chairman of SCF. Josh Robenstone

Jefferies' mandate is expected to start with a strategic review, which will look at ICG's exit options, and is likely to finish with a sale process next year.

South Australia-based SCF is one of the country's largest container equipment and ISO tank suppliers, specialising in on-site storage containers, bulk liquid storage tanks, containerised accommodation and refrigerated containers.

It has 13,000 containers and a depot network that spans across Australia, with its clients believed to include the likes of Woolworths, Toll Holdings and the Australian Defence Force.
description: Intermediate Capital Group has tapped Jefferies to help prepare shipping container provider SCF for sale.
